intro: Friedlandia myrsinites, commonly known as the yellow-flowered buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Friedlandia myrsinites is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
